Handwritten three-page letter dated 13.6.49 and address Ag.k.C. In the letter, which does not bear a signature but ends with the word friendly, the author of the letter addresses a stage director who is in Rome. Due to the distance, concerns are expressed regarding the scenography of the show. His scenographic and costuming proposals are analyzed and supported with a rich visual and theatrical vocabulary. At the end of the letter he refers to a future exhibition, his archive and the necessity, because of them, for the excellent preservation of the material he is sending. Located in Athens, Greece.

Handwritten three-page letter dated 13.6.49 and address Ag.k.C. In the letter, which does not bear a signature but ends with the word friendly, the author of the letter addresses a stage director who is in Rome. Due to the distance, concerns are expressed regarding the scenography of the show. His scenographic and costuming proposals are analyzed and supported with a rich visual and theatrical vocabulary.
